author: jason morris

review: I've been using an Apple TV for streaming for several years, and getting this Fire TV has been a revelation.  This machine has all of the same apps as the Apple product, but has a true advantage in hardware and is much smoother in operation.Pros:- Load times are shorter than the Apple TV- Default apps are comparable to Apple TV and movie selection is great- 1080 streaming works flawlessly.- Other apps are available without any jailbreaking/rooting...things like that.  You can enable developer controls and install other apps from the app store any time.  This is a HUGE bonus as you dont have to wait for people to develop FireTV specific apps.  If it's available in the Google Play store, you can load it.Cons:- No HDMI cable included.  You will need to buy one of those.
author: Nathan Lucas

review: I bought this for my parents so they could stop paying so much money for DVDs of the shows they like and it's been a god send.  My parents are extremely computer illiterate, but they had no trouble adapting to this device.  It's setup very intuitively and the remote is large enough and clear enough that they don't have any problem losing it or not understanding what the buttons mean.I have experience using both the Chromecast and Roku boxes - I now have a smartTV myself - but my parents would have been too confused with these items.  Maybe not the Roku, but I still think the Fire TV's layout is much more intuitive and functional for their needs than the Roku.
